      • genSalt

        public String genSalt()
        Generates a 64 char long Salt in the form of a String.
        Specified by:
        genSalt in class Encryption
        Returns:
        A Salt in String form, that is 64 chars long.

      • encrypt

        public String encrypt(String preparedString)
        Hashes a Prepared String using a given algorithm. In this case, SHA512 is used, however any algorithm can be used (pre-implemented algorithm's can be found in EncryptionUtils). It should be noted, that one can also make use of external APIs that implement alternative algorithms such as BCrypt. Make sure that you read through on which hashing algorithm's have been broken, before selecting your algorithm.
        Specified by:
        encrypt in class Encryption
        Parameters:
        preparedString - A prepared String. It is advised to add a salt and a pepper to this.
        Returns:
        A hash of the given String

      • prepareString

        public String prepareString(String password,
                            String salt,
                            String... peppers)
        Generates a string that can be hashed securely. In the following implementation we simply return salt+password+randomly selected pepper
        Specified by:
        prepareString in class Encryption
        Parameters:
        password - The password that you wish to hash.
        salt - The salt that you wish to use.
        peppers - A list of peppers (or not) that you wish to use. If no peppers are used, use ' new String[]{""} '.
        Returns:
        Returns a String containing salt+password+randomly selected pepper.
